p: The antifungal activity of "Mentha of Pancalieri" EO, either alone or in combination with azole drugs (fluconazole, itraconazole, ketoconazole) was assessed against a wide panel of yeast and dermatophyte clinical isolates [ 115]. The EO was analyzed by MIC in addition to GC-MS and minimum fungicidal concentration (MFC) parameters. The results suggested that the EO may act as a potential antifungal agent and could serve as a natural adjuvant for fungal infection treatment.
